content: hey @T-libs! we have our regular meeting scheduled in a bit less than three hours. However, this time we have zero rfcs, zero nominated items, and zero waiting-on-team items waiting for us (not counting those we already discussed last time). We do however have 27 PRs and some issues waiting for a review/response. So I was thinking to maybe skip the meeting this week and instead spend this time working on reviews etc. Or does anyone have something we should discuss today?
Sounds good to me. Do you have a link for the PRs to review?

Here are all the S-waiting-on-review items for T-libs, and here for T-libs-impl. Almost all of them have quite a long discussion thread going on though, so quite possibly it's blocked om some design decision or something. And some might just be mislabeled.
Oh and we still need to respond to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76901 i see in our action items list.
:+1:
Review we shall
My plan for today is to do the rewrite of the error handling blog post based on Niko's feedback
oh nice!
So I'll probably focus on that and work on reviews once I take a break
Reviewing those sounds great. Should we do that in this thread, or another thread?
I'm looking at https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/81642 , and it seems very reasonable to me. It needs a feature gate, but otherwise, I think we ought to merge it. Any objections?
posted a comment
Good point. Followed up with an alternative suggestion.
I posted review comments to a few more PRs, and re-labeled them as S-waiting-on-author.

@Mara Given that the comments about doc aliases specifically used free as an example of what we don't want (because there's no explanation and it could come across wrong), could you post the same explanation to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/83967 please?
sure!
i think we should just remove #[doc(alias = "delete")] from fn drop
Agreed.
If you want to post a PR for that, I'll r+ it.

I think https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/79943 is a relatively reasonable use of aliases, but I think we need more of a consensus on whether we want to set the precedent of using aliases for "we could have also called this...".
yes one second, was just opening the tree again. fix was merged :tada:
yay, bors is open for business again
Ah, what was the fix?

Josh Triplett said:

If you want to post a PR for that, I'll r+ it.

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/84406

Josh Triplett said:

Ah, what was the fix?

See https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/242791-t-infra/topic/expat.20gone.20missing.20from.20sourceforge/near/235513336

Josh Triplett said:

I think https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/79943 is a relatively reasonable use of aliases, but I think we need more of a consensus on whether we want to set the precedent of using aliases for "we could have also called this...".

replied
Thanks everyone for all the reviews today. We made a ton of progress!
